title: Personal
text:
My name is Lynn Kuhlwein. I am currently a German exchange student at the University of Texas at Dallas. My home university is the Philipps-University Marburg.
I was born and raised in Hannover, which is a 500.000-citizen town in the northern part of Germany.

title: Lynn Kuhlwein
text: I am Lynn Kuhlwein, a masters student of International Political Economy at the University of Texas at Dallas and Philipps-University Marburg.

title: Studies
text:
I started my Bachelor in Socio-Economics at the Christian-Albrechts-University in Kiel in 2019. I gained basic knowledge in Economics, Political Science as well as Sociology. Besides the mandatory courses I chose optional classes like Climate Change Economics, Applied Econometrics and Risk and Entrepreneurship, gaining a deeper knowledge in these areas. I also took special courses in Business Spanish. My thesis was on the topic “Gender injustice and social protests in Chile - analysis of the role of women in the estallido social an their thematic focus” which was finally graded with a 1.3. My final grade for the Bachelor was 1.4, which I received in the summer 2023.
In October 2023 I started studying the double-degree masters programm International Political Economy at the Philipps-University Marburg. After two semesters in Marburg, I am currently studying at the University of Marburg, seeking to finalize my degree in May 2025.
